DataElement.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Excision Laparoscopy Open Performed Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the diagnostic or treatment procedure involving the colon, rectum, or entire bowel initially performed laparoscopically, insertion of a thin lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen, was changed to open surgery to remove tissue samples or a diseased organ or tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colorectal Surgical Procedure Excision Laparoscopy Open Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the diagnostic or treatment procedure involving the colon, rectum, or entire bowel initially performed laparoscopically, insertion of a thin lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen, and then changin to open surgery to remove tissue samples or a diseased organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (ko-lo-REK-tul) Having to do with the colon or the rectum.:Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the colon and rectum, or to the entire large bowel.

A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Property.preferredDefinition: Removal or excision by surgical measures.:(lap-a-RAHS-ko-pee) The insertion of a thin, lighted tube (called a laparoscope) through the abdominal wall to inspect the inside of the abdomen and remove tissue samples.:Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.
A surgical procedure during which a laparoscope is inserted into the abdomen to view the abdominopelvic contents for diagnostic and/or therapeutic purposes.
Affording unobstructed entrance and exit; affording free passage or access; accessible to all.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk
